Merged pull request "Stream children in a validation traversal" (#766) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: Update ValidationTraverser to not be recursive. This allows us to stream the elements it finds, including the elements from the correct AlternateContent blocks.

Events.RelatedBody: Greatly simplifies the validation pipeline. This should allow us to actually stream the pipeline rather than a recursive approach.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Support non-nullable annotations" (#701) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
With C# 8.0 and .NET Standard 2.1 (and other supported platforms), APIs can be annotated with nullability information. This issue will track any work to enable this. So far, this would include:

- [x] Enable C# 8.0 in the project (#698)
- [ ] Enable .NET Standard 2.1
- [ ] Enable nullable annotations in non-.NET Standard 2.1 targets (through some shim to provide attributes that can be stripped out at compile time)

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "OpenXmlValidator Throws Incorrect Validation Error for CategoryAxis" (#689) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

When validating a `CategoryAxis` with an `AxisPosition` child the `OpenXmlValidator` creates a validation error even though the xml is valid according the office xml specification (CT_CatAx has a child EG_AxShared which has an element CT_AxPos on page 4080 of part I of the specification).

**Information**

- .NET Target: .NET Framework
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.10

**Repro**

```csharp
var categoryAxis = new DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Charts.CategoryAxis();
categoryAxis.AppendChild(new DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Charts.AxisPosition() { Val = new EnumValue<DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Charts.AxisPositionValues>(DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Charts.AxisPositionValues.Bottom) });

var validator = new Validation.OpenXmlValidator();
var errors = validator.Validate(categoryAxis);
``` 

**Observed**

The `errors` variable has a single entry with a description of `The element has unexpected child element 'http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/drawingml/2006/chart:axPos.'...`

**Expected**

According to `CT_CatAx` in part I of the specification (page 4080) there must be child elements `axId`, `scaling`, `axPos`, and `crossAx`. The sample above only has a `axPos` child so I would expect to see three validation errors due to the other three required elements being missing. I would not expect to see a validation error saying that `axPos` is not a valid child since the specification says that it is.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add Benchmark for create metadata" (#764) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Merged pull request "Reduce massive perf impact from a couple semantic constraints" (#763) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
This changes `IndexReferenceConstraint` and `ReferenceExistConstraint` to be much more performant. Two issues were found:

- Using validation infrastructure to just iterate through all the children in a part. Fixing this brought the example issue down from 1.5hr to 15 min
- Recalculating same required information many, many times. Caching this brought the time down from 15 min, to 33 seconds

Fixes #760

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "IndexReferenceConstraint and ReferenceExistConstraint can cause really long validation times" (#760) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Is this a:
- [X] Issue with the OpenXml library
- [ ] Question on library usage

**Description**

The attached .xlsm file takes approximately 33 minutes to validate compared to several seconds for other files

**Information**

- .NET Target: .NET Framework 4.7.2
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.11.2

**Repro**

```csharp
class Program
    {
        static List<ValidationErrorInfo> errorInfos;
        
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            OpenXmlPackage spreadsheetDocument = SpreadsheetDocument.Open("DiversenGrafieken.xlsm", false);
            Stopwatch stopwatch = new Stopwatch();

            Console.WriteLine($"DiversenGrafieken.xlsm: Validation Started at {DateTime.Now}");

            stopwatch.Start();
            errorInfos = ValidateDocument(spreadsheetDocument);
            stopwatch.Stop();

            foreach (ValidationErrorInfo info in errorInfos)
            {
                Console.WriteLine(string.Format("DiversenGrafieken.xlsm Error Occurred {0}", info.Description));
            }

            Console.WriteLine($"DiversenGrafieken.xlsm: Validation Completed In {stopwatch.Elapsed}");

            Console.ReadKey();
        }

        static List<ValidationErrorInfo> ValidateDocument(OpenXmlPackage package)
        {
            OpenXmlValidator validator = new OpenXmlValidator(FileFormatVersions.Office2016);
            List<ValidationErrorInfo> validationErrors = validator.Validate(package).ToList();

            return validationErrors;
        }
    }
``` 

Link to file
[DiversenGrafieken.zip](https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/files/4924068/DiversenGrafieken.zip) NB. Rename to .xlsm


**Observed**

The file takes approximately 33 minutes to validate

**Expected**

The file should be validated in a more timely fashion


Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Add Benchmark for create metadata" (#764) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Closed issue "OpenXmlValidator Throws Incorrect Validation Error for CategoryAxis" (#689) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

When validating a `CategoryAxis` with an `AxisPosition` child the `OpenXmlValidator` creates a validation error even though the xml is valid according the office xml specification (CT_CatAx has a child EG_AxShared which has an element CT_AxPos on page 4080 of part I of the specification).

**Information**

- .NET Target: .NET Framework
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.10

**Repro**

```csharp
var categoryAxis = new DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Charts.CategoryAxis();
categoryAxis.AppendChild(new DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Charts.AxisPosition() { Val = new EnumValue<DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Charts.AxisPositionValues>(DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Charts.AxisPositionValues.Bottom) });

var validator = new Validation.OpenXmlValidator();
var errors = validator.Validate(categoryAxis);
``` 

**Observed**

The `errors` variable has a single entry with a description of `The element has unexpected child element 'http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/drawingml/2006/chart:axPos.'...`

**Expected**

According to `CT_CatAx` in part I of the specification (page 4080) there must be child elements `axId`, `scaling`, `axPos`, and `crossAx`. The sample above only has a `axPos` child so I would expect to see three validation errors due to the other three required elements being missing. I would not expect to see a validation error saying that `axPos` is not a valid child since the specification says that it is.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support non-nullable annotations" (#701) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
With C# 8.0 and .NET Standard 2.1 (and other supported platforms), APIs can be annotated with nullability information. This issue will track any work to enable this. So far, this would include:

- [x] Enable C# 8.0 in the project (#698)
- [ ] Enable .NET Standard 2.1
- [ ] Enable nullable annotations in non-.NET Standard 2.1 targets (through some shim to provide attributes that can be stripped out at compile time)
